description: General-content map of eastern New York Province including Vermont and portions of adjacent provinces. Relief shown by hachures. Original title. Prime meridian: New York City. Facsimile. Original version: London : Engraved and published by William Fadden [thus], Charing Cross, January 4th 1779. Compiled from actual surveys deposited in the Patent Office in New York by order of His Excellency Major General William Tryon by Claude Joseph Sauthier Esqr. [Dedicated] To His Excellency Major General William Tryon, governor of the Province of New York ... Claude Joseph Sauthier. When affixed to the cloth backing the map sheet was sectioned to 25 panels to enable folding. The map cover on verso is in 2 separate panels. Both cover panels on the verso are signed in ink: Map of New Netherlands 1779, Millard Fillmore, July 6, 1854, no. 145. Includes notes and landowners' names. Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image. Vault

medium: 1 map : mounted on cloth backing ; on sheet 96 x 71 cm, folded in cover 21 x 14 cm.

description: Covers New York State and parts of adjacent states/provinces. Also shows canals. Relief shown by hachures. LC Railroad maps, 265 Hand colored in red to emphasize railroads in service/abuilding/proposed and in blue to emphasize state lines. LC copy imperfect: Sectioned to 20 panels to enable folding, mounted on cloth backing, hemmed at edges with pink fabric. Signed in ink script at upper right: Millard Fillmore 1861; and on verso on cloth backing: No. 107. Millard Fillmore. May 15, 1861. Paper label with inked script attached to verso: New York rail roads 1861. No. 107. Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image.

description: Newly drawn map of the State of Delaware as it was in the year 1787. Also covers the Delaware Bay (entire). "Simplified from a 1787 map by John Churchman. Original in the Library of Congress." Prime "Meridian of Philad'a--5h.0.35 west from Greenwich". Includes reproduced title cartouche of the original 1787 map at upper right: To the American Philosophical Society--this map of the peninsula between Delaware & Chesapeak Bays ... is humbly inscribed by John Churchman. Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image.

contributors: United States. Constitution Sesquicentennial Commission, cartographer, publisher.
created_published: [Washington, D.C.] : United States Constitution Sesquicentennial Commission, [1937?]

contributor: united states. bureau of public roads
description: The maps show the proposed route for an automobile parkway following the Chesapeake & Ohio Canal between the Washington (D.C.) boundary and Cumberland (Md.). Title from title page of accompanying text. In upper margin on all sheets: National Park Service. Statement of attribution at foot of title on the three 1:75,000-scale map sheets: Branch of Development, National Capital Parks, U.S. Department of the Interior. Additional statement of attribution in lower left margin on the 1:75,000-scale sheets: National Park Service, Branch of Development, History Division, National Capital Parks, Bureau of Public Roads. Each of the 1:75,000-scale maps includes several circular insets, a sheet assembly diagram, and pictorial illustrations in the map area. Accompanied by text booklet (81st Congress, 2d Session--House Document No. 687): Chesapeake & Ohio Canal report--Letter from Assistant Secretary of the Interior (x, 87 pages : illustrations, tables, diagrams; 24 cm). Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image. In lower margin on all sheets: 71542 O - 50.

contents: Plate 1 [1:575,000-scale map of entire proposed parkway route] -- Plate 2, Survey of the proposed C. & O. Canal parkway, sheet 1 of 3, Great Falls to Harpers Ferry -- Plate 3, Survey ... parkway, sheet 2 of 3, Harpers Ferry to Hancock -- Plate 4, Survey ... parkway, sheet 3 of 3, Hancock to Cumberland -- Plate 5, Survey ... parkway, Relation of existing features of the canal with development recommended for the parkway [graph/diagram] -- Plate 6, Flood conditions, N.C.P., sheet 1 of 3 [text and graphs] --  Plate 7, Flood conditions, N.C.P., sheet 2 of 3 [graphs] -- Plate 8, Flood conditions, N.C.P., sheet 3 of 3 [graphs].
contributors: United States. National Park Service, cartographer.
United States. Bureau of Public Roads, cartographer.
United States. Government Printing Office, publisher.
created_published: Washington [D.C.] : United States Government Printing Office, 1950.
medium: 4 maps and 4 diagrams on 8 sheets ; 41 x 89 cm or smaller, sheets 45 x 92 cm or smaller, folded to 23 x 14 cm, jointly in pocket envelope 24 x 15 cm
notes: The maps show the proposed route for an automobile parkway following the Chesapeake & Ohio Canal between the Washington (D.C.) boundary and Cumberland (Md.).
Title from title page of accompanying text.
In upper margin on all sheets: National Park Service.
Statement of attribution at foot of title on the three 1:75,000-scale map sheets: Branch of Development, National Capital Parks, U.S. Department of the Interior.
Additional statement of attribution in lower left margin on the 1:75,000-scale sheets: National Park Service, Branch of Development, History Division, National Capital Parks, Bureau of Public Roads.
Each of the 1:75,000-scale maps includes several circular insets, a sheet assembly diagram, and pictorial illustrations in the map area.

Accompanied by text booklet (81st Congress, 2d Session--House Document No. 687): Chesapeake & Ohio Canal report--Letter from Assistant Secretary of the Interior (x, 87 pages : illustrations, tables, diagrams; 24 cm).
Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image.
In lower margin on all sheets: 71542 O - 50.

description: This record covers single maps of California as a whole, which are not represented in the LC database by separate catalog records. This collection includes single printed maps and photocopies of printed or manuscript single maps as well as multi-sheet single maps, plates from atlases, books or periodicals, and printed facsimiles. To request a specific map or for more information, contact a reference librarian in the Geography & Map Division (202) 707-6277 or through the "Ask a librarian" link through the Geography & Map Division website https://www.loc.gov/rr/geogmap/. Title supplied by cataloger. Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image. Most maps earlier than 1800 in this collection are photocopies or facsimiles.

medium: 1 drawer of maps : some color, some hand colored, some photocopies ; various sizes.

description: Shows the area of northeastern France where the Franco-Prussian War (1870-71) was in progress. Does not show battle/troop positions or military features. Covers the regions of Paris, Metz, Strasbourg, and the Rhine Valley. Relief shown by shading. Text on cover in English and German. Title from bottom of sheet recto. "Enterred [thus] according to act of Congress in the year 1870 by E. Steiger, in the office of the Librarian of Congress at Washington, D.C." Signed in ink script on cover: Millard Fillmore, Sept. 9, 1870, No. 110. T. [and] Millard Fillmore, Sep't 9, 1870, .75. LC copy imperfect: Use-worn, torn at fold lines, cover is taped to sheet verso. Includes index to Strasbourg points-of-interest and city coat-of-arms. City insets: Metz [with city wall] -- Paris [metro-area including ring of fortresses] -- Strasbourg [with city wall]. Texts, title panel, and publisher's advertisements on cover. Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image.

created_published: New York : Published by E. Steiger, 1870.
medium: 1 map : color ; 48 x 63 cm, folded in cover 19 x 12 cm.
notes: Shows the area of northeastern France where the Franco-Prussian War (1870-71) was in progress.
Does not show battle/troop positions or military features.
Covers the regions of Paris, Metz, Strasbourg, and the Rhine Valley.
Relief shown by shading.
Text on cover in English and German.
Title from bottom of sheet recto.
"Enterred [thus] according to act of Congress in the year 1870 by E. Steiger, in the office of the Librarian of Congress at Washington, D.C."
Signed in ink script on cover: Millard Fillmore, Sept. 9, 1870, No. 110. T. [and] Millard Fillmore, Sep't 9, 1870, .75.
LC copy imperfect: Use-worn, torn at fold lines, cover is taped to sheet verso.
Includes index to Strasbourg points-of-interest and city coat-of-arms.
City insets: Metz [with city wall] -- Paris [metro-area including ring of fortresses] -- Strasbourg [with city wall].
Texts, title panel, and publisher's advertisements on cover.
Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image.

description: General-content map of the Netherlands showing the seven constituent provinces. Hand colored to distinguish the areas and boundaries of the provinces. Prime meridian: Ferro. When affixed to the cloth backing the map sheet was sectioned to 16 panels to enable folding. Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image. There is no handwritten Millard Fillmore signature on recto or verso. LC sheet imperfect: Use-worn, lightly foxed, taped on cloth backing (verso) at fold lines, G&M acquisition rubber-stamping in map area at foot of title. Includes table of "Methodical division of the Seven United Provinces" and 3 bar scales. Annotated in ink on cloth backing (verso): 132, Seven United Provinces, Holland, 3 (handwritten on small paper adhesive label). Vault

created_published: London : Printed for the Proprietor, Carington Bowles, [1785?]

notes: General-content map of the Netherlands showing the seven constituent provinces.
Hand colored to distinguish the areas and boundaries of the provinces.
Prime meridian: Ferro.
When affixed to the cloth backing the map sheet was sectioned to 16 panels to enable folding.

Annotated in ink on cloth backing (verso): 132, Seven United Provinces, Holland, 3 (handwritten on small paper adhesive label).

description: Relief shown by hachures. Hand colored to emphasize boundaries of administrative provinces and gubernias. Title from map sheet recto. In German. Prime meridians: Paris and Ferro. The upper right panel of the cloth backing (on verso) is signed in ink: Millard Fillmore, Russia, June 1856; 2 paper labels are affixed to this same panel--a mapseller's printed advert containing a small city-center map and another label handwritten in ink "Russia in Europe--1854". Before the application of the cloth backing the map sheet was sectioned to 36 panels to enable folding. Includes note, small glossary, inset "Grundriss von St. Petersburg gezeichnet von A. Roetsch", and index to St. Petersburg points-of-interest. Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image. Vault

created_published: Weimar [Germany] : Im Verlage des geograph. Instituts, 1854.
medium: 1 map : color, mounted on cloth backing ; 118 x 85 cm, folded to 21 x 16 cm.
notes: Relief shown by hachures.
Hand colored to emphasize boundaries of administrative provinces and gubernias.
Title from map sheet recto.
In German.
Prime meridians: Paris and Ferro.

The upper right panel of the cloth backing (on verso) is signed in ink: Millard Fillmore, Russia, June 1856; 2 paper labels are affixed to this same panel--a mapseller's printed advert containing a small city-center map and another label handwritten in ink "Russia in Europe--1854".
Before the application of the cloth backing the map sheet was sectioned to 36 panels to enable folding.
Includes note, small glossary, inset "Grundriss von St. Petersburg gezeichnet von A. Roetsch", and index to St. Petersburg points-of-interest.
Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image.
